{"step_by_step_thinking": "Ossifying fibroma is a benign fibro-osseous lesion. According to Document [27], from a radiological perspective, ossifying fibroma generally manifests as a well-defined and delimited, unilocular radiotransparency. Radiotransparency refers to the passage of more x-rays or other forms of radiation through a material, making it appear darker on the radiograph. Therefore, it is equivalent to radiolucency.", "answer_choice": "A"}
